(Based on the series ''[[Melrose Place (1992 TV series)|Melrose Place]]'' created by [[Darren Star]]) | format = [[Serial (radio and television)|Serial]] | country = United States | language = English | network = [[The CW Television Network|The CW]] | Status = Canceled | num_seasons = 1 | num_episodes = 18 | list_episodes = List of Melrose Place (2009 TV series) episodes | executive_producer = [[Todd Slavkin]] and [[Darren Swimmer]]
[[Greg Beeman]] | composer = [[Danny Lux]] | location = [[Van Nuys, California]] | runtime = approx. 42 minutes | picture_format = [[1080i]] ([[HDTV]]) | audio_format = [[Dolby Digital|Dolby Digital 5.1]] | company = [[CBS Television Studios]] | first_aired = {{Start date|2009|09|08}} | last_aired = {{Start date|2010|04|13}} | status = Ended | preceded_by = ''[[Beverly Hills, 90210]]''
''[[Melrose Place (1992 TV series)|Melrose Place]]''
''[[Models Inc.]]''
''[[90210 (TV series)|90210]] | starring =[[Katie Cassidy]]
[[Colin Egglesfield]]
[[Stephanie Jacobsen]]
[[Jessica Lucas]]
[[Michael Rady]]
[[Shaun Sipos]]
[[Ashlee Simpson|Ashlee Simpson-Wentz]] | website = | status = Canceled }} '''''Melrose Place''''' is an American television series broadcast on [[The CW Television Network]] from September 8, 2009 to April 13, 2010.{{cite web|url=http://hollywoodinsider.ew.com/2009/05/the-cw-announce.html|title=''EW'' Hollywood Insider: The CW announces fall schedule: ''Melrose Place'' paired with ''90210''|last=Stransky|first=Tanner|date=May 21, 2009|publisher=HollywoodInsider.EW.com|accessdate=July 11, 2009}}{{cite news |first=Lynette |last=Rice |title=Exclusive: Daphne Zuniga returns to ''Melrose Place'' |publisher=EW.com |date=July 14, 2009 |accessdate=July 15, 2009 |url=http://hollywoodinsider.ew.com/2009/07/melrose-place-daphne-zuniga-closes-deal-to-reprise-her-role.html }} The fifth series in the [[Beverly Hills, 90210 franchise|''Beverly Hills, 90210'' franchise]], it is an updated version of the 1990s [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]] prime time drama [[Melrose Place (1992 TV series)|of the same name]], featuring a group of young adults living in a [[West Hollywood, California]] apartment complex.{{cite web|url=http://melrose-place.org/photo/albums/promo/poster/01.jpg|title=''Melrose Place'' promotional poster|publisher=Melrose-Place.org|accessdate=July 12, 2009}}{{cite web |url=http://login.vnuemedia.com/hr/login/login_subscribe.jsp?id=yF3FFJoP9vNm5af43q8W2RKsNqDmrM1%2Fzbx5AiSOUtGW3Ls9PUV5GMgJS%2BeoDy1JR6XRNFhZpiGV%0AuGoJS7RJB%2BpJnUVMLSDQ5B8l6AHiXZ%2B1wAAIzxH1BnZI6WmQKJx8GoWY%2BuCJjYxQDAOD9x59MjQz%0AaAG%2F4%2BtoYa1POTzHtgmnGrnkGnbYoH9qdhYK2%2BCS9KTxeCr1n5NNHtR25eWKkK4OTah2SXoBku8W%0AVqSbaRrO7Ff00s4KOuyAIJQ3vmUFlbhqCUu0SQfqSZ1FTC0g0OQfJegB4l2f7NOeqj%2FwpMiUXMks%0A7crR4o3zhDcRndE46JnI7gLg1I1URYAYpXhhafaLRph5cBeorXBKxcUVtxZI1gKKdPPgig%3D%3D |title=CW greenlights ''Melrose Place'' pilot |date=February 23, 2009 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |accessdate=July 15, 2009}}{{cite web |url=http://www.eonline.com/uberblog/b101380_CWs_Melrose_Place_Redo_Ramps_Up.html |title=CW's ''Melrose Place'' Redo Ramps Up |first=Gina |last=Serpe |publisher=EOnline.com |date=February 24, 2009 |accessdate=July 12, 2008}} ''[[Smallville]]'' producers [[Todd Slavkin]] and [[Darren Swimmer]] were [[show runner]]s of the series. The series was canceled after just one season. ==Development== After successfully relaunching the franchise with ''[[90210 (TV series)|90210]]'' in 2008, there was considerable speculation as to whether The CW planned to create a new version of ''Melrose Place'' in a similar vein. An article in E! Online reported the possibility of a new version of ''Melrose'' in September 2008,{{cite web |url=http://www.eonline.com/uberblog/marc_malkin/b30508_melrose_place_now_under_renovation.html |title=''Melrose Place'': Now Under Renovation? |first=Marc |last=Malkin |publisher=EOnline.com |date=September 23, 2008 |accessdate=July 12, 2008}} though The CW declined to confirm any such project at that time. Some weeks later, The CW and [[CBS Paramount Network Television]] (successor-in-interest of [[Spelling Television]] and therefore the legal rights holders to ''Melrose Place'') said they were "exploring the possibility" of creating a new version of the series, to potentially debut in the 2009â2010 TV season and targeting their "prized demographic: young women."{{cite web|url=http://www.tvweek.com/news/2008/10/studio_cw_in_talks_for_new_mel.php|title=Studio, CW in Talks for New ''Melrose Place''|last=Adalian|first=Josef|date=October 2008|publisher=TVWeek.com|accessdate=July 12, 2009}}{{cite web |url=http://www.eonline.com/uberblog/marc_malkin/b66075_melrose_place_gets_new_lease_on_life.html |title=''Melrose Place'' Gets a New Lease on Life |first=Marc |last=Malkin |publisher=EOnline.com |date=October 28, 2008 |accessdate=July 12, 2008}}{{cite web|url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,444785,00.html|title=''Melrose Place'' Spinoff In the Works|date=October 29, 2008|publisher=FoxNews.com|accessdate=July 12, 2009}} Original series creator [[Darren Star]] also confirmed that discussions had taken place, but nothing was official. On October 31, 2008, ''Entertainment Weekly'' writer Michael Ausiello reported that ''[[One Tree Hill (TV series)|One Tree Hill]]'' creator [[Mark Schwahn]] had been approached about running what was being called ''"Melrose Place 2.0"''.{{cite web |url=http://ausiellofiles.ew.com/2008/10/one-tree-hill-b.html |title=Exclusive ''Melrose 2.0'' Deets: Heather Returning? ''One Tree'' Boss Helming? |first=Michael |last=Ausiello |publisher=EW.com |date=October 31, 2008 |accessdate=July 12, 2009}} ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' confirmed on December 14, 2008 that Schwahn was in negotiations to write the initial script for the potential series.{{cite web |url=http://login.vnuemedia.com/hr/login/login_subscribe.jsp?id=yF3FFJoP9vNm5af43q8W2RKsNqDmrM1%2Fzbx5AiSOUtGW3Ls9PUV5GMgJS%2BeoDy1JNvcjJJawnoyd%0Ae62B148QmC9bMPuRgylKX%2BEwBcBfes7NKQoa5YLg5ZRcySztytHijfOENxGd0ThRGXd%2F2zxGvz96%0AE4q69zYSe1O2SdB2pP%2FtxmdMaGaDB%2FpkglPq8k%2F3 |title=New ''Melrose Place'' lands writer |date=December 14, 2008 |work=The Hollywood Reporter |accessdate=July 15, 2009}}{{cite web |url=http://sn.soapnet.go.com/news/article/mark-to-melrose-place |title=Mark to ''Melrose Place'' |last=Lynn |first=Megan |date=December 15, 2008 |publisher=SOAPnet.com |accessdate=July 15, 2009}}{{cite web |url=http://www.zap2it.com/tv/news/zap-markschwahnwritingmelroseplaceupdate,0,6089794.story |title=''One Tree Hill'' Creator Moves into ''Melrose Place'' |date=December 15, 2008 |publisher=Zap2it.com |accessdate=July 15, 2009}} In January 2009, The CW's head of entertainment, [[Dawn Ostroff]], discussed the network's plans to develop a ''Melrose Place'' update, stating that she had yet to identify a writer, and that the proposed project would include both returning and new characters.{{cite web |url=http://community.post-gazette.com/blogs/tunedin/archive/2009/01/12/press-tour-journal-reviving-melrose-place.aspx |title=Press Tour Journal: Reviving ''Melrose Place'' |first=Rob |last=Owen |publisher=Post-Gazette.com |date= January 12, 2009 |accessdate=July 12, 2009}} She noted that the original ''Melrose Place'' series which began in 1992 started "at a time not unlike what we're going through now ... they talked about the building being foreclosed on, people not having jobs. It took place in a very similar time, a time when the economy was in a downturn." Ostroff also told reporters that unlike the original series, the new version would try to capture life in the Los Angeles Melrose neighborhood. When asked whether the new series would be the "earnest ''Melrose'' of season one or the nutty Kimberly-blowing-up-the-apartment-complex of later years," Ostroff explained, "In the beginning you've got to get invested in the characters, but I also think it can't be so dramatic and sleepy that not enough is going on. Our fans really love that heightened drama as you can see when you watch ''One Tree Hill'' and ''[[Gossip Girl]]''. So the job is to get them emotionally invested in the people and then do storytelling and have twists and turns and surprises you wouldn't have expected." On January 19, 2009, with Mark Schwahn now officially off the project, Ausiello reported that The CW were talking with Darren Swimmer and Todd Slavkin (showrunners of The CW's ''[[Smallville]]'') about helming the new ''Melrose Place''.{{cite web |url=http://ausiellofiles.ew.com/2009/01/exclusive-small.html?xid=rss-feed-tvwatch-%27Melrose+Place%27+meets+%27Smallville%27%3F.html |title=Exclusive: ''Smallville'' bosses mull ''Melrose'' remake |first=Michael |last=Ausiello |publisher=EW.com |date=January 19, 2009 |accessdate=July 12, 2009}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} On February 6, 2009 Ausiello confirmed that Swimmer and Slavkin were officially hired as the show runners of the spin-off, and discussed some of the new show's characters that were yet to be cast.{{cite web |url=http://ausiellofiles.ew.com/2009/02/exclusive-look.html |title=Exclusive: Look who's moving into the new ''Melrose Place'' |first=Michael |last=Ausiello |publisher=EW.com |date=February 6, 2009 |accessdate=July 12, 2009}}{{cite web |url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/showtracker/2009/02/melrose-place-r.html |title=''Smallville'' producers set to helm ''Melrose Place'' reboot |first=Denise |last=Martin |publisher=LATimes.com |date=February 6, 2009 |accessdate=July 12, 2009}} ''The Hollywood Reporter'' reported on February 23, 2009 that The CW had officially [[greenlight|greenlit]] a pilot episode for the new ''Melrose Place'' written by Swimmer and Slavkin, which would "follow the original formula and chronicle a new group of twenty-somethings dwelling in Los Angeles' perpetually trendy Melrose neighborhood."{{cite web |url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/showtracker/2009/02/melrose-place-1.html |title=''Melrose Place'' remake will be directed by an Oscar winner |last=Fernandez |first=Maria Elena |date=February 24, 2009 |publisher=LATimes.com |accessdate=July 15, 2009}} [[Academy Award]]-winner [[Davis Guggenheim]] (''[[An Inconvenient Truth]]'') was announced as the director and executive producer of the pilot. The new series, ultimately just titled ''Melrose Place'' like its 1990s predecessor, premiered on The CW on September 8, 2009. ==Casting== [[File:MP2009-CastSsn01.jpg|thumb|left|400px|Cast of ''Melrose Place'' (2009)]] Ausiello's February 6, 2009 character preview introduced the series' seven new characters: David Patterson, son of the previous version's Jake Hanson "with the taut abs and thick black book to prove it;" his "omnisexual sometime lover" Ella Flynn, "a PR whiz whose tongue is as sharp as her stilettos;" Jonah Miller, an aspiring filmmaker; Riley Richmond, his "sickly-sweet schoolteacher fiancee;" Auggie Kirkpatrick, a "hunky hippie" and recovering alcoholic; "straight-arrow" med student Lauren Bishop, forced by hard times to "trade sexual favors for financial ones;" and Violet Foster, a small-town teen who is "fresh off the turnip truck" but knows how to "play the sex kitten" when necessary. On February 25, 2009, ''The Hollywood Reporter'' reported that the first actor cast in the new series was [[Michael Rady]], whose character Jonah was compared to [[Andrew Shue]]'s Billy Campbell from the original ''Melrose Place''.{{cite web |title=From ''Swingtown'' to ''Melrose Place'' |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/hr/content_display/television/news/e3i195c363ab252f976b127ef168e8c9204 |work=The Hollywood Reporter |date=February 25, 2009 |accessdate=July 15, 2009}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' announced on February 27, 2009 that [[Katie Cassidy]] had landed the role of Ella,{{cite web |last=Schneider |first=Michael |title=CW casts ''Melrose Place'', ''Vampire'' |url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118000691.html?categoryid=14&cs=1&nid=2565 |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=February 27, 2009 |accessdate=July 15, 2009}}{{cite web |last=Mitovich |first=Matt |title=Pilot News: Cassidy Hits ''Melrose'', McQueen Bites into ''Vampire'' |url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/Pilot-Cassidy-McQueen-1003538.aspx |publisher=TVGuide.com |date=February 27, 2009 |accessdate=July 15, 2009}} whom Ausiello had previously compared to [[Heather Locklear]]'s Amanda Woodward. On March 9, 2009 Ausiello reported that singer/actress [[Ashlee Simpson|Ashlee Simpson-Wentz]] had been cast as Violet, and quoted an unnamed inside source saying that talks with Locklear to reprise her role were "looking good."{{cite news |first=Michael |last=Ausiello |title=Scoop: Ashlee Simpson moves into ''Melrose Place'' |publisher=EW.com |date=March 9, 2009 |accessdate=July 15, 2009 |url=http://ausiellofiles.ew.com/2009/03/scoop-ashlee-si.html }} ''The Hollywood Reporter'' announced on March 17, 2009 that [[Jessica Lucas]] had won the role of Riley.{{cite web |title=Jessica Lucas moves into ''Melrose Place'' |url=http://login.vnuemedia.com/hr/login/login_subscribe.jsp?id=5oqi%2BHOaP1Ii4cw0KvPMlj09VHoUU1ZntqHzmkNCG5YG9WAq6db9hzY%2FRuFNP72sVprx29DNuTFI%0AOG0f7pNqUXUEweXNU5z3WVDuwEbkgFh1qDp45gO4qCKROG2UdFA94IPOHeWji5UUQfaYPQVf3Gd2%0AhWd7UtPFwxmqgWqUF54aPvv1fq16ETj6UMfNaZObHyrYArJSIu8cv%2BORZ9DfPdKO24%2BqjTHLBdD0%0A3VBNmeoVxRY81h11dIyZ86HUCFokSDhtH%2B6TalF1BMHlzVOc91lQ7sBG5IBYPmC%2FvPAts5y8rqow%0AOVQHS5WY7PjIrjGxUbmFWGhMjWB3KF5f5bvkzE5euraoVuXDLuG6D07kQUUVjyRqd6%2BS2w%3D%3D |work=The Hollywood Reporter |date=May 17, 2009 |accessdate=July 15, 2009}}{{cite web |url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/Jessica-Lucas-Melrose-1004159.aspx |title=Jessica Lucas Moves From ''90210'' to ''Melrose Place'' |first=Joyce |last=Eng |publisher=TVGuide.com |date=March 18, 2009 |accessdate=July 12, 2009}} The next day ''Entertainment Weekly'' broke the story that despite The CW "aggressively pursuing" her, Locklear had passed on the ''Melrose Place'' update, purportedly because "There wasn't a way to bring her back that made sense."{{cite web |url=http://hollywoodinsider.ew.com/2009/03/exclusive-heath.html?xid=rss-feed-tvwatch-Heather+Locklear%3A+No+%27Melrose+2%2E0%27 |title=''EW'' Hollywood Insider: ''Melrose Place'' exclusive; Heather Locklear won't join reboot |last=Snierson |first=Dan|date=March 18, 2009 |publisher=HollywoodInsider.EW.com |accessdate=July 15, 2009}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} On March 24, 2009, [[Colin Egglesfield]] was cast as Auggie, and [[Stephanie Jacobsen]] as Lauren.{{cite news |first=Nellie |last=Andreeva |title=''Melrose Place'' adds two more residents |work=The Hollywood Reporter |date=March 24, 2009 |accessdate=July 15, 2009 |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/hr/content_display/news/e3ie7d1eee3b5e787af8120dac29a3c17a2}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}{{cite news |first=Matt |last=Mitovich |title=Pilot News: ''Terminator'' Toughie Turns Tricks on ''Melrose'' |work=TVGuide.com |date=March 25, 2009 |accessdate=July 15, 2009 |url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/Pilot-Jacobsen-Egglesfield-1004356.aspx}} ''The Hollywood Reporter'' reported on April 3, 2009 that [[Shaun Sipos]] had landed the final regular role in the series â Jake's son David â now described as a rich kid whose "bad-boy behavior has cut him off from the family's money."{{cite web |url=http://blog.zap2it.com/frominsidethebox/2009/04/melrose-place-casts-shaun-sipos-as-bad-boy-20.html |title=''Melrose Place'' casts Shaun Sipos as Bad Boy 2.0 |last=Nguyen |first=Hanh |date=April 4, 2009 |publisher=Zap2it.com |accessdate=July 15, 2009}}{{cite news |title=Shaun Sipos joins ''Melrose Place'' |work=The Hollywood Reporter |date=April 3, 2009 |accessdate=July 15, 2009 |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/hr/content_display/television/news/e3ie2a94edbc5b0a7c11343f1de78f72da1}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}{{cite web |url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/Pilot-Melrose-Leighton-1004747.aspx |title=Leighton Lords over New ''Melrose'' Pilot! Plus: Meet Jake's Son |last=Mitovich |first=Matt |date=April 5, 2009 |publisher=TVGuide.com |accessdate=July 15, 2009}} On April 5, 2009 ''The Hollywood Reporter'' broke the story that [[Laura Leighton]] would be joining the series as her original ''Melrose Place'' character [[Sydney Andrews]].{{cite web |title=Laura Leighton moving back to ''Melrose Place'' |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/hr/content_display/television/news/e3if8bcecb2de71aac3ab98b0dd04833410 |work=The Hollywood Reporter |date=April 5, 2009 |accessdate=July 15, 2009}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}{{cite news |title=Scheming Sydney Returns To ''Melrose Place'' |work=[[Entertainment Tonight]] |publisher=ETOnline.com |date=April 6, 2009 |accessdate=July 15, 2009 |url=http://www.etonline.com/news/2009/04/72533/index.html}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} Though Sydney had seemingly been killed off in 1997 at the end of the original show's fifth season, the new pilot finds her alive and now the landlord of the titular apartment complex. ''TV Guide'' noted that Leighton would also continue in a recurring capacity should the updated ''Melrose Place'' be picked up. ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'' reported on April 6, 2009 that ''Melrose Place'' original cast member [[Thomas Calabro]] would also reprise his series-long role as the duplicitous Dr. Michael Mancini, now established as the father of new character David (Sipos).{{cite web |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20270500,00.html |title=Another Original ''Melrose'' Cast Member Returns |last=Aradillas |first=Elaine |date=April 6, 2006 |publisher=People.com |accessdate=July 15, 2009}}{{cite web |url=http://www.accesshollywood.com/heather-locklear/melrose-place-reboot-nabs-two-original-cast-members_article_16394 |title=''Melrose Place'' Reboot Nabs Two Original Cast Members |date=April 7, 2006 |publisher=AccessHollywood.com |accessdate=July 15, 2009}} ==Production== Ausiello reported on May 19, 2009 that the series had been picked up by The CW.{{cite web |url=http://ausiellofiles.ew.com/2009/05/exclusive-witho.html |title=Exclusive: ''Without a Trace'', ''Privileged'', canceled, ''Gossip'' spin-off DOA |first=Michael |last=Ausiello |publisher=EW.com |date=May 19, 2009 |accessdate=July 15, 2009}} Presenting its 2009â2010 season schedule on May 21, 2009, The CW announced its intention to air ''Melrose Place'' after ''90210'' on Tuesday nights, in the same way their parent shows had been paired when the original ''Melrose Place'' debuted on Fox in July 1992.{{cite web |url=http://news-briefs.ew.com/2009/05/the-cw-will-pai.html |title=''Melrose Place'' and ''90210'' to air back-to-back this fall |last=Snierson |first=Dan|date=May 20, 2009 |publisher=EW.com |accessdate=July 15, 2009}}{{cite web |url=http://www.tvweek.com/news/2009/05/cw_upfront_melrose_place_vampi.php |title=CW Upfront: ''Melrose Place'', ''Vampire Diaries'' on Tap |last=Lafayette |first=Jon |date=May 21, 2009 |publisher=TVWeek.com |accessdate=July 15, 2009}}{{cite web |url=http://featuresblogs.chicagotribune.com/entertainment_tv/2009/05/cw-upfronts-new-schedule-smallville.html |title=The Watcher: CW moves ''Smallville'' and unleashes a new ''Melrose Place'' |last=Ryan |first=Maureen |date=May 21, 2009 |publisher=ChicagoTribune.com |accessdate=July 15, 2009}} Ostroff added that there would likely be some character crossover between the two shows. Sipos's, Cassidy's, and Jacobsen's characters had also been renamed "David Breck," "Ella Simms," and "Lauren Yung" in the press release. With the series in production, the ''Los Angeles Times'' noted on August 30, 2009 that the new ''Melrose Place'' intends to reflect life in Los Angeles beyond the way the original did by filming "everywhere from skid row to Sunset Boulevard and using popular venues, such as the Cinerama Dome and Walt Disney Concert Hall, as well as opulent mansions in Malibu and the so-called bird streets of the Hollywood Hills."{{cite web |url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/news/la-ca-melrose30-2009aug30,0,5602928.story |title= A return to ''Melrose Place'' |last=Fernandez |first=Maria Elena |date=August 30, 2009 |publisher=LATimes.com |accessdate=September 9, 2009}} Executive producers Slavkin and Swimmer both grew up in L.A., and wanted to update the series "in a really cool, relevant way and not just slap the name ''Melrose Place'' on it." Concerned about repeating the same difficulties which occurred when incorporating original series characters in the ''90210'' update, The CW's Ostroff was drawn to Slavkin and Swimmer's intent to "create a new world but also hang on to what was special about ''Melrose'' originally ... I wanted to make sure that we used the old characters in the right way, in a way that made sense to the new characters as well." Swimmer added, "We felt the only way to incorporate the old characters into the new show was for it to feel like it was part of the story and came from the story." On September 23, 2009, ''Variety'' reported that The CW had ordered an additional six scripts for the series, despite its ratings thus far being a "disappointment."{{cite news |first=Michael |last=Schneider |title=CW gives full-season order to ''Tree'' |publisher=Variety.com |date=September 23, 2009 |accessdate=September 24, 2009 |url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118009104.html?categoryId=14&cs=1 }}{{cite web |url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/Tree-Diaries-Melrose-1010129.aspx |title=The CW Orders More ''Melrose'', ''One Tree Hill'' and ''Vampire Diaries'' |last=Abrams |first=Natalie |publisher=TVGuide.com |date=September 23, 2009 |accessdate=October 4, 2009}} On October 21, 2009, The CW officially ordered five more episodes of the series, bringing the total to eighteen.{{cite news |first=Michael |last=Ausiello |title=Scoop: ''Vampire Diaries'', ''Melrose Place'' picked up! |publisher=EW.com |date=October 21, 2009 |accessdate=October 21, 2009 |url=http://ausiellofiles.ew.com/2009/10/21/scoop-vampire-diaries-picked-up-for-full-season/ }} A day later in an interview with Ausiello, Slavkin and Swimmer announced that Egglesfield, Simpson-Wentz, and Leighton would leave the series once the murder mystery is resolved in episode 12.{{cite news |first=Michael |last=Ausiello |title=Exclusive: Simpson and Egglesfield out in ''Melrose Place'' shake-up |publisher=EW.com |date=October 22, 2009 |accessdate=October 22, 2009 |url=http://ausiellofiles.ew.com/2009/10/22/simpson-and-egglesfield-fired-on-melrose-place/ }} Egglesfield told E! Online that his departure was a network decision driven by the show's weak ratings, and that his character Auggie would not be killed off.{{cite news |first=Jennifer |last=Godwin |title=Exclusive: Colin Egglesfield Explains His Shocking Dismissal from ''Melrose Place'' |publisher=E! Online |date=October 22, 2009 |accessdate=October 22, 2009 |url=http://www.eonline.com/uberblog/watch_with_kristin/b150330_colin_egglesfield_explains_his_shocking.html/ }} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} ===Guest stars=== ''People'' reported on June 18, 2009 that [[Josie Bissett]], who portrayed Michael's ex-wife and Sydney's older sister Jane Mancini in the original series, would guest star in at least one episode.{{cite web |url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20286231,00.html |title=Josie Bissett Returns to New ''Melrose Place'' |last=Wang |first=Cynthia |date=June 18, 2009 |publisher=People.com|accessdate=July 15, 2009}} [[Taylor Cole]] was next booked to guest star as David's ex-girlfriend, followed by [[Taryn Manning]] as a singer whose music video is directed by Jonah.{{cite news |first=Michael |last=Ausiello |title=Scooplets on ''Psych'', ''Supernatural'', ''Melrose Place'', and more! |publisher=EW.com |date=July 13, 2009 |accessdate=July 15, 2009 |url=http://ausiellofiles.ew.com/2009/07/casting-scoops-on-psych-supernatural-and-more.html }} The next day, ''Entertainment Weekly'' reported that original series star [[Daphne Zuniga]] would be returning as photographer Jo Reynolds for at least two episodes.{{cite news |title=News & Notes/The Hollywood Insider: Original ''Melrose Place'' star Daphne Zuniga will guest on the reboot |date=July 24, 2009 |work=Entertainment Weekly |publisher=Issue #1057 |page=16}} On July 17, 2009, ''E! Online'' announced that actress [[Brooke Burns]] had been cast as Vanessa, wife of Dr. Michael Mancini and mother of his younger son Noah.{{cite news |first=Jennifer |last=Godwin |title=Brooke Burns Joins the Cast of ''Melrose Place'' |publisher=EOnline.com |date=July 17, 2009 |accessdate=July 18, 2009 |url=http://www.eonline.com/uberblog/watch_with_kristin/b134787_brooke_burns_joins_cast_of_melrose_place.html }} That same day, ''TV Guide Magazine'' reported that actor [[Victor Webster]] had also been cast as Caleb, Ella's gay publicist boss.{{cite news |first=William |last=Keck |title=Exclusive: New Names Moving to ''Melrose'' |publisher=TVGuideMagazine.com |date=July 17, 2009 |accessdate=July 22, 2009 |url=http://www.tvguidemagazine.com/kecks-exclusives/exclusive-new-names-moving-to-melrose-1758.html }} On July 20, 2009, ''E! Online'' reported that actress [[Kelly Carlson]] had been cast as a madam who convinces Lauren to work for her as part of her prostitution ring.{{cite news |first=Jennifer |last=Godwin |title=Meet ''Melrose Place'' 's Newest Lady of the Night |publisher=EOnline.com |date=July 20, 2009 |accessdate=July 20, 2009 |url=http://www.eonline.com/uberblog/watch_with_kristin/b135051_meet_melrose_places_newest_lady_of_night.html }} On August 19, 2009, ''E! Online'' announced that actress [[Jenna Dewan]] would appear on the series for at least two episodes as Kendra Wilson, a movie development executive who has her eyes on Jonah.{{cite news |first=Drusilla |last=Moorhouse |title=Jenna Dewan Gets "Wickedly Sexy" on Melrose Place |publisher=EOnline.com |date=August 19, 2009 |accessdate=August 22, 2009 |url=http://www.eonline.com/uberblog/watch_with_kristin/b140140_jenna_dewan_gets_wickedly_sexy_on.html }} Later that week, ''E! Online'' confirmed that Locklear was again in talks to join the update as her original series character Amanda.{{cite news |first=Jennifer |last=Godwin |title=Heather Locklear Is in Talks to Return to ''Melrose Place'' |publisher=EOnline.com |date=August 21, 2009 |accessdate=August 22, 2009 |url=http://www.eonline.com/uberblog/watch_with_kristin/b140552_heather_locklear_in_talks_return.html }} On August 31, 2009, former [[Los Angeles Lakers|LA Laker]] [[Rick Fox]] announced he'd be guest starring on the series as an LA club owner.{{cite web |url=http://twitter.com/Rickafox/status/3672616189 |title=Melrose Place on the CW Tuesday nights this fall Sept. 8th check it out I play an LA club owner.. |first=Rick |last=Fox |authorlink=Rick Fox |publisher=Twitter |date=August 31, 2009 |accessdate=September 6, 2009}} A rep for ''Melrose Place'' later confirmed the news to ''[[Access Hollywood]]'', stating that Fox would appear in the eighth episode.{{cite news |title=Rick Fox Filming Scenes For âMelrose Placeâ |publisher=AccessHollywood.com |date=September 3, 2009 |accessdate=September 6, 2009 |url=http://www.accesshollywood.com/rick-fox-filming-scenes-for-melrose-place_article_22533 }} On September 22, 2009, The CW announced that [[Heather Locklear]] would finally join the update in its tenth episode. Show runners Slavkin and Swimmer were quoted as saying "We're ecstatic to have the chance to bring Amanda Woodward back to Melrose Place. Heather's involvement in the show is something we've been working on for some time, as we couldn't imagine creating and producing this show without the iconic character's inclusion."{{cite news |first=Gina |last=Serpe |title=Amanda, er, Heather Finally Locks Into Melrose Place |publisher=EOnline.com |date=September 22, 2009 |accessdate=September 22, 2009 |url=http://www.eonline.com/uberblog/b145425_amanda_er_heather_finally_locks_into.html }} Ausiello revealed that Locklear would play Ella's boss at WPK, calling it "a genius move that will pit the showâs former and current vixens against one another."{{cite news |first=Michael |last=Ausiello |title='Melrose' scoop: New details on Heather Locklear's return! |publisher=EW.com |date=September 22, 2009 |accessdate=September 22, 2009 |url=http://ausiellofiles.ew.com/2009/09/22/melrose-scoop-new-details-on-heather-locklears-return/ }} On October 9, 2009, ''TV Guide Magazine'' reported that actor [[Billy Campbell]] had been cast as a powerful billionaire who would be involved with Amanda and first appear in episode thirteen.{{cite news |first=William |last=Keck |title=Amanda Gets A Man |publisher=TVGuideMagazine.com |date=October 9, 2009 |accessdate=October 16, 2009 |url=http://www.tvguidemagazine.com/melrose-place/amanda-gets-a-man-2772.html }} On October 27, 2009, Ausiello reported that actor [[Nick Zano]] was in talks to join as a pseudo-replacement for Colin Egglesfieldâs Auggie.{{cite news |first=Michael |last=Ausiello |title=Exclusive: 'Cougar Town' hottie Nick Zano relocating to 'Melrose Place'? |publisher=EW.com |date=October 27, 2009 |accessdate=October 27, 2009 |url=http://ausiellofiles.ew.com/2009/10/27/nick-zano-relocates-to-melrose-place/ }} Zano later confirmed his casting in an interview with the ''Entertainment Weekly'' columnist, revealed that he would play a doctor who works with Lauren and moves into the Melrose apartment complex, and that his role is recurring.{{cite news |first=Michael |last=Ausiello |title=New 'Melrose' hottie Nick Zano on inevitable nudity: 'It's not something I look forward to' |publisher=EW.com |date=November 2, 2009 |accessdate=December 1, 2009 |url=http://ausiellofiles.ew.com/2009/11/02/melrose-place-nick-zano-first-interview/ }} ==Cancellation== Lagging ratings caused frequent speculation that the show would not be brought back for a second season. [http://tvbythenumbers.com/ "TV By The Numbers"], a site that publishes television ratings to the public, repeatedly stated that the show had not hit its target audience and was likely to be cancelled.http://tvbythenumbers.com/2010/04/06/life-unexpected-going-down-to-the-wire/47472 After the season finale, series producer [[Darren Swimmer]] left a statement on his Twitter account saying, "Melrose Place: Thnx for the love, fans. Honestly, a season 2 looks like it ain't gonna happen. All signs say no, but no official word yet."http://twitter.com/DSwim/status/12207626565 On May 18, 2010, two days before the new CW line-up was to be released, Swimmer left another message about the fate of the show: "I think it's fair to say we won't be renewed for next season. It was a great run. Mad props to everyone involved with the show & our fans!"http://twitter.com/DSwim/status/14209364025 The CW officially canceled the series on May 20, 2010. [http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2010/05/19/cws-melrose-place-canceled/51848 CW's Melrose Place Canceled] ''TV By The Numbers'' May 19, 2010 ==Plot== On May 21, 2009, Ausiello reported that Leighton's character Sydney dies in the pilot and sets off a murder mystery, but noted that the actress would continue to appear in multiple episodes of the season through flashbacks.{{cite web |last=Ausiello |first=Michael |authorlink=Michael Ausiello |title=''Melrose'' twist revealed |url=http://ausiellofiles.ew.com/2009/05/major-spoiler-a.html|publisher=EW.com |date=May 21, 2009 |accessdate=July 11, 2009}} The ''Los Angeles Times'' later confirmed that Sydney would be found dead in the first 10 minutes of the premiere episode, a turn of events which means "anything could happen" in the new series, according to executive producer Slavkin. "It will feel nostalgic, but it's not the old ''Melrose''," Slavkin said. The ''Times'' added that initial episodes would revolve around the interrelationships of the apartment complex's seven residents and the theme that "no one is exactly who they seem," with Sydney's murder solved mid-season. As the series opens, new Melrose Place resident Violet finds Sydney floating dead in the courtyard pool. Student doctor Lauren reluctantly accepts cash for sex to pay her medical school tuition, as aspiring filmmaker Jonah is offered a directing deal in exchange for his silence about a famous director's indiscretion. David, Sydney's ex-lover and the police's initial suspect in her death, is bailed out of jail by bisexual publicist Ella, who provides a false alibi and has her own reasons for wanting Sydney out of the way. While David steals a valuable painting from his own father Michael Mancini in the dark of night, [[sous chef]] Auggie â seemingly the resident most upset by Sydney's death â burns a bloody chef's uniform. Holding onto her job puts pressure on Ella, whose efforts to further secret crush Jonah's career do not help his relationship with his new fiancÃ©e Riley. Lauren is compelled to continue prostituting herself, and while Sydney's sister Jane's attempt to blackmail Ella fails, she follows through on her promise to clue in the police on Ella's motives for Sydney's murder. Mousy Violet is revealed to be Sydney's secret daughter, and schemes to both get close to Auggie, and punish Michael for mistreating Sydney. ==Characters== {{Main|List of Melrose Place (2009 TV series) characters}} {| class="wikitable" |- !! style="background-color: #73C2FB;" colspan="4"|Starring{{cite web |url=http://www.docstoc.com/docs/9463706/MELROSE-PLACE |title=''Melrose Place'' press release |author=The CW |publisher=DocStoc.com |date=August 2009 |accessdate=October 22, 2009}} |- !! style="background-color: #73C2FB;"|Actor !! style="background-color: #73C2FB;"|Character !! style="background-color: #73C2FB;"|Year !! style="background-color: #73C2FB;"|Notes |- | [[Katie Cassidy]] || [[Ella Simms]] || 2009â2010 || |- | [[Colin Egglesfield]] || August "Auggie" Kirkpatrick || 2009â2010 || Season 1: Episodes 1â13 |- | [[Stephanie Jacobsen]]|| Lauren Yung || 2009â2010 || |- | [[Jessica Lucas]] || Riley Richmond || 2009â2010 || |- | [[Michael Rady]] || Jonah Miller || 2009â2010 || |- | [[Shaun Sipos]] || David Breck || 2009â2010 || Son of original series character Dr. Michael Mancini |- | [[Ashlee Simpson|Ashlee Simpson-Wentz]] || [[Violet Foster]] || 2009â2010 || Season 1: Episodes 1â13; Daughter of original series character Sydney Andrews{{cite news |first=Marcy |last=Medina |coauthors= |title=L.A. Story: Ashlee Simpson-Wentz Takes on ''Melrose Place'' |work=[[Women's Wear Daily]] |page= |date=August 5, 2009 |accessdate=August 15, 2009|quote= |url=http://www.wwd.com/fashion-news/la-story-ashlee-simpson-wentz-takes-on-melrose-place-2229927?page=2}} |- !! style="background-color: #73C2FB;" colspan="4"|Guest starring/Recurring role |- !! style="background-color: #73C2FB;"|Actor !! style="background-color: #73C2FB;"|Character !! style="background-color: #73C2FB;"|Year !! style="background-color: #73C2FB;"|Notes |- | [[Josie Bissett]] || Jane Andrews || 2009â2010 || Special Guest Star, from original series |- | [[Thomas Calabro]] || Dr. Michael Mancini || 2009â2010 || Special Guest Star, from original series |- | [[Laura Leighton]] || [[Sydney Andrews]] || 2009â2010http://www.spoilersguide.com/melrose-place/episode-18-official-synopsis-3/ || Special Guest Star, from original series |- | [[Heather Locklear]] || |Amanda Woodward || 2009â2010 || Special Guest Star, from original series |- | [[Daphne Zuniga]] || Jo Reynolds || 2009â2010 || Special Guest Star, from original series |- | [[Brooke Burns]] || Vanessa Mancini || 2009-2010 || Season 1: Episodes 1â12 and 14 (1 and 14 as an uncredited voice) |- | [[Billy Campbell]] || Ben Brinkley || 2010 || |- | [[Kelly Carlson]] || Wendi Mattison || 2009â2010 || |- | [[Niall Matter]]|| Rick Paxton || 2009-2010 |- | [[Adam Kaufman (actor)|Adam Kaufman]] || Toby Shepard || 2009 |- | [[Ethan Erickson]] || Chef Marcello || 2009 || |- | [[Nicholas Gonzalez]] || Detective James Rodriguez || 2009 || |- | Jason Olive || Detective Drake || 2009 || |- | [[Victor Webster]] || Caleb Brewer || 2009 || |- | [[Nick Zano]] || Drew Pragin || 2010|| |- | [[Mason Vale Cotton]] || Noah Mancini || 2009-2010 || |} ==Episodes== {{Main|List of Melrose Place (2009 TV series) episodes}} ==Reception== === U.S. Nielsen ratings === {| class="wikitable" style="margin: auto; width: 100%" |- ! rowspan="2"|Season ! rowspan="2"|Episodes ! rowspan="2"|Timeslot ! colspan="3"|Original airing ! rowspan="2"|Viewers
(in millions) ! rowspan="2"|Annual rank ! rowspan="2"|Rating/Share
(18-49) |- ! Season premiere ! Season finale ! TV season |- | style="text-align:center" |[[List of Melrose Place (2009) episodes|1]] | style="text-align:center" |18 | style="text-align:center" |Tuesday 9/8c |
September 8, 2009 |
April 13, 2010 | style="text-align:center" |[[2009â2010 United States network television schedule|2009â2010]] | style="text-align:center" | '''1.39'''{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.com/2010/06/16/final-2009-10-broadcast-primetime-show-average-viewership/54336 |title=Final 2009-10 Broadcast Primetime Show Average Viewership - TV Ratings, Nielsen Ratings, Television Show Ratings |publisher=TVbytheNumbers.com |date= |accessdate=2010-06-16}} | style="text-align:center" |#138 | style="text-align:center" |0.7 |} === Critical === ''Entertainment Weekly's'' Ken Tucker gave the pilot a B, stating that "it remains to be seen whether the new ''Melrose'' will become as giddily addictive as its predecessor â but it's off to a promisingly dizzy start."{{cite web |url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,20301979,00.html |title=TV Review: ''Melrose Place'' (2009) |first=Ken |last=Tucker |publisher=EW.com |date=September 2, 2009 |accessdate=September 6, 2009}} The ''Los Angeles Times'' compared the update to the original, noting that "Camp has given way to noir, soap has morphed into mystery, and acting and dialogue have become more sophisticated while alcoholism, drug addiction, infidelity and even murder remain among the permanent residents of the fictitious 4616 Melrose Place." ''The Hollywood Reporter'' stated "It's all brand new and shiny but comfortably familiar and keenly calculated. The pleasures abound within the walls of the new "MP," but be warned: You'll want to take a shower afterward."http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/hr/tv-reviews/melrose-place-tv-review-1004009558.story ''Melrose Place'' was the No. 1 trending topic on Twitter for about an hour on its debut night, and its ratings put it in second place among its core young adult audience in the 9 pm hour.{{cite web |url=http://ausiellofiles.ew.com/2009/09/09/melrose-place-ratings-snapshot-disappointing/ |title=''Melrose Place'' ratings snapshot: Disappointing |first=Michael |last=Ausiello |publisher=EW.com |date=September 9, 2009 |accessdate=September 9, 2009}} [[Metacritic]] gave the episode a Metascore of 57, signifying mixed reviews, a weighted average based on a select 23 critical reviews.{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/tv/shows/melroseplace2009?q=melrose%20place |title=''Melrose Place'' |publisher=Metacritic.com |accessdate=September 9, 2009}} == International syndication == ''Melrose Place'' began airing in 26 countries in [[Latin America]] on November 10, 2009 via [[Sony Entertainment Television (Latin America)|Sony Entertainment Television]].http://www.canalsony.com/ Episodes are aired in English, and are subtitled in Spanish, Portuguese, or French. As in the US, the series follows ''[[90210 (TV series)|90210]]'' on Tuesdays.http://www.entornointeligente.com/resumen/resumen.php?items=977831 In Canada, the series airs on the Canwest Global a day later than The Airing on The CW 10ET/PST 8MT/AST on Wednesdays In [[Israel]] the series airs on [[Yes Stars Next|yes stars Next]] on Sundays at 8:40 pm starting January 17, 2010. Later, ABCFamily Israel aired this series on repeats. In the UK, the series aired on [[Fiver (channel)|Fiver]] on Wednesdays, at 9.00pm for the first eight episodes before moving to the 8.00pm slot.http://www.five.tv/programmes/drama/melrose-place The premiere aired on February 3, 2010 and scored 113,000 viewers. The series concluded on June 2, 2010. In Portugal, the series aired on Wednesday's at 9:15pm for the first nine episodes before moving to the 10.20pm slot on [[FOX Life Portugal]]. In the Philippines the series is set to air on [[Velvet (TV channel)|Velvet]] and will air Tuesday at 9:30 pm starting January 19, 2010.The series was later moved to 10:00 pm {{Citation needed|date=January 2010}} In Australia, the series was intended to air on [[Network Ten]]. In New Zealand, the series began airing February 17, 2010 on [[C4]]. In The Netherlands the series wil begin airing also mid 2010 on [[RTL 5]]. In Russia the series began airing weekdays at 23:00 on [[Muz-TV]] on March 15, 2010. In Norway the series began airing Wednesday April 21 at 7:00 pm on [[TV2 Zebra]]. In Ireland the series airs Tuesday Mornings at 02:30am on [[RTÃ Two]]. In Greece, the series begun airing on October 2010 on [[Skai TV]] as a lead-in to ''[[90210 (TV series)|90210]]'' but it was canceled after 3 episodes due to low ratings and replaced by [[The Good Wife (TV series)|The Good Wife]] encores. The show returned on a late night slot on February 2011 but got canceled again after the 6th episode aired. Episodes 7-18 air in August-September 2011 on a late night slot. In Georgia the series began airing October 2010. In Chile, the series was premiered on January 9, 2011 on [[MEGA (Chilean TV channel)|Mega]]. In Slovenia, the series premiered on January 21, 2011 on [[TV3 Slovenia]]. It airs Weekdays at 11 am. In France , the series premiered on March 16, 2011 on [[M6]]. It airs Wednesday at 3 pm. In Germany, the series premiered on July 4, 2011 on [[Sixx]] and aired Mondays at 9 pm as a lead-out to ''[[Gossip Girl]]''. The show was a success for the network with an average audience over 90 000 viewers and a 0.6 Rating among the 14-49 target group. === DVD release === As of October 26, 2010, [[Amazon.com|Amazon]]'s CreateSpace manufacture-on-demand (MOD) program began exclusively selling ''Melrose Place'': The DVD Edition. This is a 6-disc set (740 minutes) with the entire run of the show, plus bonus cast interviews.
